title: The Bachelorette star Warwick Adams' Tinder profile emerges
text:
The Bachelorette's Warwick Adams stormed off the show last week after he was unhappy he had dress as a chicken during a photoshoot challenge.

After leaving Angie Kent, 29, stunned by his exit, the 36-year-old now appears to be hoping his five minutes of fame may help him find love on dating app Tinder.

An profile in the construction supervisor's name that is using his promotional picture from The Bachelorette has emerged, and it even jokes about the show.

Awkward! The Bachelorette's Warwick Adams (pictured) appears to be looking for love on Tinder after storming off the show last week over a chicken costume

'Someone give me a rose, I'm getting withdrawals,' the dating app profile reads.

One of the Tinder account's main pictures are from the dating show's first cocktail party, alongside other selfies from Warwick's Instagram profile.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Warwick for comment.

'Someone give me a rose': A Tinder profile (pictured) in the construction supervisor's name that is using his official promo picture from The Bachelorette has emerged

Moving on? One of the Tinder account's main pictures are from the dating show's first cocktail party, alongside other selfies (pictured) from Warwick's Instagram profile

Last week, viewers watched Warwick quit the show following an altercation during a group photoshoot on Thursday night.

After being invited on a group date, the chosen contestants were each given animal costumes to wear for a farmyard-themed scene.

But Warwick, who wore the chicken costume, flew into a rage when his rivals poked fun of his attire, claiming they had 'gone too far' and he was 'f***ing over it'.

Warwick immediately started pulling off the costume and said he'd had enough.

Not happy! Last week, viewers watched Warwick quit the show after he was unhappy that he had to wear a chicken costume during a farmyard themed photoshoot

'You know what well f**k off mate. I'm f***ing over it. I've just f**king pulled the pin. But that's... this is too far,' he said, before later telling the other contestants he was heading home

He raged: 'You know what well f**k off mate. I'm f***ing over it. I've just f**king pulled the pin. But that's... this is too far.'

Angie later claimed she was 'ghosted' by the suitor, making it appear he left without saying goodbye, but Daily Mail Australia revealed this was not the case.

Previously published paparazzi pictures revealed the pair sharing an emotional goodbye, which bizarrely never made it to television.
description: The Bachelorette's Warwick Adams stormed off the show last week after he was unhappy he had dress as a chicken during a photoshoot challenge.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
